basics.name: Edwin Pérez Aragón
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary: I'm a fullstack developer who is used to work with all the parts involving a web app (Front-End, Back-End, Databases, Deployment). I'm a good team player who is focusing on delivering value to the client through the hard work. I'm always looking for improving myself so feedback is essential for me. I like to share all my experience with others through blogging, contributing to open source and more!

work.name: Datazone Intern
work.summary: I was part of the developers team on the call center area for the Autozone stores. My main role was to develop alonside other developers a new tool for the people monitoring the ongoing events in the ticketing system they use which was capable to present the tickets information in a friendly manner.
highlights: Learned Java + Spring Framework, Thymeleaf, jQuery, Angular, MySQL and Subversion. Implement a module with these tecnologies that read the ongoing events in the call-center and displayed information about them. Showed information with conditional coloring depending on the status of the events and the ability to filter and sort the results in a table

work.name: Grupo Red Software Development
work.summary: I was part of the development team of the compay working for multiple projects accordingly to the needs of the clients.
highlights: Learned ASP.NET Web Forms, SQL Server, C#, Team Foundation Server

work.name: PK Global
work.summary: I'm part of the development team assigned to the Midas company. Developing solutions to implement their web page, adminitration site for the same web page and also its maintenance
highlights: I earned a MCSA: Web Applications Certification issued by Microsoft

Successfully implemented the site's redesign at the same time we replatformed the old ASP.NET Web forms tecnology we used to a more recent ASP.NET MVC 5 platform, transparent to the client through 6 phases without stopping serving the site and giving it the required maintenance. We also improved our site performance using the best practices.
Successfully refactored the site to meet the AA ADA compliance wihch improved our site's accessiblity

publications.name: How to Send a Complex Type List of Objects to SQL Server
publications.summary: Tutorial on how to send a list of multiple complex objects to SQL Server from C#

publications.name: The Evil Is In The Details
publications.summary: Simple debugging session on using the XMLHttpRequest object
